result.execSummary:
The defendant Tarryl D Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Seek and maintain full-time, gainful employment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to Count 1

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 04-09-2015/tk
PSI received and reviewed.  No claim for restitution.  No additions/corrections to psi.
Statement by defendant's mother
Recommendation.  Ct 1:  3 yrs WPS 3 yrs ES, Ct 4: 1 yr WPS, 2 yrs ES stand silent as to consecutive or concurrent
Sentencing argument
Statement by defendant
BTC:  Ct 1:  4 yrs> 2 WPS 2 ES
           Ct 4:  2 yrs> 1 WPS 1 ES, consecutive to count 1

no alcohol/controlled substances except Rx
counseling appropriate
full time gainful employment
no possession of any firearm 
DNA sample and surcharge
FAW/voting prohibited
CIP And SAP
court costs
CFTS
Sentencing hearing on February 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State files and amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt of same, waives its reading and enters NG plea. The State is in compliance with Ch. 971 & 950. Upon plea to Cts 1 & 4, Cts 2 &3 are DRI. In Ct 1, the State recommends 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES. In Ct 4, the State recommends 1 yr IC, 2 yrs ES  - ss on consec/conc and State will not pursue potential bail jump charges.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on December 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
MIL's filed by the State. Sequestration order is granted. Defense is not planning on offering any witnesses. The State indicates that the video's are being sent to the DA and defense's are ready to pick up. The State has no further MIL's. All witnesses have been served. Anticipated length is 1 1/2 days. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.
The Court will give the following preliminary instructions 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101. Ladwig hearing to be conducted just prior to picking the jury. Parties may stipulate to statements ahead of time and if they do, Mr. Simmonds will advise the Court.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court's clerk reached Mr. Simonds by telephone and indicated that his non appearance was due to a calendaring error. The Court set this matter over to 1:15 pm today

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Christopher James Simonds and attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Attorney Anderson moves to withdraw.  Attorney Simonds has already been appointed and should be ready for trial on 12/9.
BTC:  Motion granted.

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Anderson is asking for bond to be modified to co-signature bond with deft's sister, Tameka Hicks and if any cash bond is required, it be modest - $500.00 - $1,000.00. Defense indicates that they do not oppose GPS. The State requests bond remain as currently set. They feel it is appropriate due to the allegations and defendant's previous criminal history. The State asks that no action be taken in regards with the no contact provision with any of the listed victims.

BTC: Bond modification is denied
Judge Gasiorkiewicz has denied the defense's request to adjourn the speedy trial. Ms. Anderson notified via email
ATTY Anderson requesting new trial date.
Pre-trial conference on December 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense asks that bond be amended to $500.00 cash with co-signature with his sister. The State objects to bond modification as requested and notes that they have prosecuted the proposed co-signer for ID theft.
Defense makes verbal speedy trial demand

BTC: bond modification is denied  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim TP AW LG (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Tarryl D Hicks in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
